snippet: Members of the sect Ansar Dine went door to door to arrest the leaders of an earlier protest against them, a resident said.
abstract: Radical Islamists in northern Mali briefly detain about 90 protesters and whip them in what appears to be an attempt to intimidate residents of a town; members of the Islamist group Ansar Dine go door to door to arrest the leaders of an earlier protest against them in Goundam, a town about 60 miles west of Timbuktu.
lead_paragraph: Members of the sect Ansar Dine went door to door to arrest the leaders of an earlier protest against them, a resident said.
